pageConfig.title: Albania Travel Companion
pageConfig.subtitle: Essential info, language help, and insider secrets for Albania

taxiCompanies.name: Blue Taxi
taxiCompanies.details: App-based booking available, cheaper than official airport taxis

taxiCompanies.name: Speed Taxi
taxiCompanies.details: App-based booking available, cheaper than official airport taxis

taxiCompanies.name: Merr Taxi
taxiCompanies.details: App-based booking available, cheaper than official airport taxis

taxiCompanies.name: Green Taxi
taxiCompanies.details: App-based booking available, cheaper than official airport taxis

airportTransport.details: Accepts cash, card, and euros. Luggage storage available.
Auto Holiday Albania - yellow taxis with airport logo sitting outside arrivals. No need to pre-book.
Speed Taxi, Patoko, Bee Taxi apps available. Uber NOT available in Albania

publicTransport.details: Extensive network covering all major areas and cities. Check Google Maps for arrival/departure times. Pay on board with exact change.
Comprehensive network connecting all major Albanian cities. Buses depart from North/South bus terminals and tickets can be purchased on-site or online through Gjirafa Travel.
Very limited railway system. Main route connects Tirana to Durrës port. Service can be unreliable.
Growing bike rental network in tourist areas (listnride.com). Some hotels offer complimentary bike rentals.
Electric scooters available from local rental shops. Requires valid license and deposit, but not recommended due to lack of dedicated lanes.

importantNotes.currency: Prices can be paid in EUR or Albanian LEK (1 EUR ≈ 98-99 LEK as of 2025)
importantNotes.uberStatus: Uber is NOT available in Albania as of 2025
importantNotes.busSchedule: Luna bus runs 24/7, departing every hour on the hour
importantNotes.trafficWarning: Allow extra time during rush hours (7-9:30am, 4-6:30pm)

drivingTips.title: Speed Limits
drivingTips.tip: 40 km/h in urban areas, 80-90 km/h on main roads, 110 km/h on motorways

drivingTips.title: Gas Stations
drivingTips.tip: Prices around 173 ALL/liter for diesel, ~200-220 ALL/liter for gasoline (2025 prices)

drivingTips.title: Tolls
drivingTips.tip: Only A1 highway (Durres-Kosovo) has tolls - one toll booth near Kalimash Tunnel

drivingTips.title: Navigation
drivingTips.tip: Google Maps works well in 2025, offline maps recommended for remote mountain areas

drivingTips.title: Road Conditions
drivingTips.tip: Excellent on main highways, yellow roads good, avoid white roads (dirt tracks)

drivingTips.title: Police Checks
drivingTips.tip: Frequent speed cameras and traffic police. Always carry license, registration, insurance

roadTips.title: Defensive Driving
roadTips.tip: Albanian drivers can be aggressive - maintain safe distances and drive defensively

roadTips.title: Rush Hours
roadTips.tip: Avoid 7-9am and 5-7pm in Tirana - traffic gets very congested

roadTips.title: Mountain Roads
roadTips.tip: Mountain roads are narrow and winding - honk before blind curves

roadTips.title: Animals on Roads
roadTips.tip: Watch for livestock and stray dogs, especially on rural roads

roadTips.title: Weather Conditions
roadTips.tip: Roads can be slippery when wet - reduce speed during rain

carRentals.details: Counter in terminal, flexible rental options, available nationwide
Terminal location, international brand, available nationwide
Like-new vehicles, accepts debit cards and Amex, available nationwide

rentalRequirements.details: Valid driver's license from home country

rentalPricing.recommendation: Best for city and coastal driving
Good balance of comfort and efficiency
Recommended for mountain regions and rough terrain

rentalTips.title: Book in Advance
rentalTips.tip: Better rates and availability, especially during summer season

rentalTips.title: Compare Prices
rentalTips.tip: Use comparison sites to find best deals across different companies

rentalTips.title: Choose Right Vehicle
rentalTips.tip: Compact for cities, SUV for mountains - automatic transmission limited

rentalTips.title: Pickup Locations
rentalTips.tip: Available at airports, seaports like Saranda, and city centers

localDrivingStyle.title: Enthusiastic Drivers
localDrivingStyle.tip: Local driving style can be aggressive - stay alert and defensive

localDrivingStyle.title: Expect Assertiveness
localDrivingStyle.tip: Albanian drivers are confident and may drive more aggressively than tourists expect

parkingZones.price: 100 ALL/hour (Zone A), 40 ALL/hour (Zone B), 20 ALL/hour (Zone C)
parkingZones.notes: Payment via SMS to 50500. Paid Mon-Fri 7:30 AM-8:00 PM. Free evenings, weekends often free
Mostly paid parking during business hours
4 underground levels, some free hours with purchases
Some hotels allow non-guests for small fee

secretSpots.title: Early Bird
secretSpots.tip: Arrive before 9am for better city center spots, paid parking starts 7:30 AM

secretSpots.title: Residential Streets
secretSpots.tip: Look for white parking lines (free), avoid blue lines (paid). Respect private markers

secretSpots.title: Hotel Lobbies
secretSpots.tip: Many allow non-guests to park for 500-1000 ALL fee - ask nicely at reception

secretSpots.title: Underground Municipal
secretSpots.tip: 3 municipal underground parkings: Skanderbeg, Bajram Curri/Rruga Elbasanit, Zogu I

secretSpots.title: Weekend Strategy
secretSpots.tip: Most paid zones free on weekends/holidays. TEG mall always free Sat-Sun

importantNotes.title: SMS Parking Payment
importantNotes.note: Send SMS to 50500 with car number and zone. Requires Albanian phone number and credit.

importantNotes.title: Blue vs White Lines
importantNotes.note: Blue lines = paid parking, White lines = free parking. Yellow = no parking (disabled/taxi).

importantNotes.title: Tirana Parking Crisis
importantNotes.note: Severe parking shortage in city center. Consider staying outside center or using public transport.

importantNotes.title: Weekend Advantage
importantNotes.note: Most parking free on weekends and public holidays - best time to visit city center by car.

currency.name: Albanian Lek
currency.historicalNote: Currency was revalued: 10 new Lek = 100 old Lek. Some vendors may still quote in old Lek.

exchangeGuidelines.importantNote: Lek can only be exchanged within Albania and possibly Kosovo

atmInformation.availability: Common in larger cities like Tirana, Durrës, Vlorë
atmInformation.ruralAccess: Limited in smaller towns and rural areas
atmInformation.recommendation: Withdraw in Euro and then exchange to Lek for better rates
atmInformation.bankingTip: Check international transaction fees with your bank before traveling

paymentMethods.cashUsage: Preferred payment method, especially outside major city centers

creditCards.acceptance: Limited, mainly in tourist areas and larger establishments
creditCards.ruralAreas: Very limited acceptance in rural areas

paymentMethods.practicalAdvice: Always carry a mix of smaller and larger denominations

paymentTips.title: Card Acceptance
paymentTips.tip: Cards accepted in most restaurants, hotels, and shops in cities

paymentTips.title: Cash Priority
paymentTips.tip: Cash still king in rural areas, markets, and small businesses

paymentTips.title: ATM Access
paymentTips.tip: ATMs everywhere in Tirana, Durrës, Vlorë and other major cities, but limited in rural areas

paymentTips.title: Tipping Guide
paymentTips.tip: Tipping: 10% restaurants, round up taxis, 100-200 ALL housekeeping

paymentTips.title: Exchange Safety
paymentTips.tip: Avoid exchanging money on the street - use official exchange offices

paymentTips.title: Currency Confusion
paymentTips.tip: Currency was revalued: 10 new Lek = 100 old Lek. Some vendors may still quote in old Lek. Ask if prices are quoted in 'new' or 'old' Lek to avoid confusion

travelTips: Cash is king, especially outside major city centers
Carry cash when visiting smaller towns or rural areas
Always confirm whether prices are in new or old Lek
Check international transaction fees with your bank
Exchange money only at banks or licensed exchange offices

touristTraps.alternative: Try Pazari i Ri (New Bazaar) for authentic & cheaper food - renovated in 2017 with quality vendors and reasonable prices

touristTraps.trap: Expensive souvenir shops in city center
touristTraps.alternative: Visit local markets for genuine crafts, or shop at Pazari i Ri for local products

touristTraps.trap: Tourist-targeted taxi drivers at airport and lack of Uber/Bolt
touristTraps.alternative: Use Speed Taxi App, UPs Taxi App, or pre-booked hotel transfers - Uber and Bolt don't operate in Albania

touristTraps.trap: Beach club fees in Saranda/Durrës and private beaches
touristTraps.alternative: Many free public sections available on most beaches, or budget around €5-20 for sunbed rentals

localSecrets.location: Byrek Special 'Luani' near InterContinental or Byrek te Çastit - locals queue here daily for fresh traditional pastries
Kafe Flora - one of Albania's oldest coffee shops from 1972, immortalized in song, authentic atmosphere
National museums have specific free weekdays - ask at reception for current schedule
Dajti Express cable car - go 1 hour before sunset for stunning views with fewer crowds

priceSecrets.detail: Many restaurants offer 'menu dite' (daily menu) for 500-800 ALL (€4-7) - great value for full meals
Bars offer 2-for-1 drinks typically 17:00-19:00, especially in Blloku district
Small family-run grocery usually have cheaper prices than well-established supermarket chains like Conad and Carrefour

safetyTips.title: Night Safety
safetyTips.detail: Tirana city center safe at night, but avoid poorly lit areas

safetyTips.title: Pickpockets
safetyTips.detail: Rare but watch belongings in crowded areas like markets

safetyTips.title: Road Safety
safetyTips.detail: Driving is hazardous and often aggressive. Avoid night driving in rural areas

safetyTips.title: Transportation
safetyTips.detail: Use marked taxis and exercise caution with road quality variations

safetyTips.title: Water Safety
safetyTips.detail: Drink bottled water to avoid potential health issues

safetyTips.title: Mountain Hiking
safetyTips.detail: Always inform someone of your route, weather changes quickly

safetyTips.title: Beach Safety
safetyTips.detail: Some beaches lack lifeguards - swim with caution

healthInfo.title: Pharmacies
healthInfo.detail: Many open 24/7 in city centers, look for "Farmaci" signs

healthInfo.title: Health Insurance
healthInfo.detail: EU health cards accepted, travel insurance with medical evacuation recommended

healthInfo.title: Medications
healthInfo.detail: Carry prescription medications. Limited medical facilities outside Tirana

healthInfo.title: Vaccinations
healthInfo.detail: No mandatory special vaccinations required for Albania

naturalHazards.title: Earthquakes
naturalHazards.detail: Occasional earthquakes occur. Follow local safety protocols

naturalHazards.title: Flooding
naturalHazards.detail: Winter flooding possible in some areas

naturalHazards.title: Wildfires
naturalHazards.detail: Summer wildfire potential in forested areas

ferryRoutes.frequency: Up to 30 daily crossings (summer), minimum 1 daily (off-season)

ports.name: Sarandë
ports.facilities: Small terminal, close to city center

bookingTips.title: Book in Advance
bookingTips.tip: Reserve tickets early, especially during peak tourist season (June-August)

bookingTips.title: Check Schedules
bookingTips.tip: Ferry schedules change seasonally - always verify current timetables with operators

bookingTips.title: Vehicle Transport
bookingTips.tip: Car transportation costs €90-110 additional and requires advance booking

bookingTips.title: Seasonal Variations
bookingTips.tip: More frequent crossings in summer, reduced schedules in off-peak seasons

bookingTips.title: Pricing Factors
bookingTips.tip: Prices vary by season, route, vehicle type, and cabin class selection

generalInfo.title: Journey Times
generalInfo.tip: Short routes: 30min-7hrs | Long routes: 9-24hrs depending on departure port

generalInfo.title: Budget Planning
generalInfo.tip: Budget €15-60 for passenger tickets, plus €90-110 for vehicle transport

generalInfo.title: Peak Season
generalInfo.tip: Summer months have the most options but require advance booking

providers.name: Voyafly
cons: Speeds may slow after 2GB daily limit

providers.name: ByteSIM
cons: Daily data caps on some plans

providers.name: Airalo
features: Strong local coverage with Hej Telecom

setupInstructions.title: Check Device Compatibility
setupInstructions.description: Ensure your device supports eSIM technology
setupInstructions.details: Check your phone specifications for eSIM support before purchasing

setupInstructions.title: Choose Your Provider
setupInstructions.description: Select from recommended providers based on your needs
setupInstructions.details: Consider data requirements, budget, and trip duration

setupInstructions.title: Purchase and Download
setupInstructions.description: Buy your plan and receive QR code or app download
setupInstructions.details: Complete purchase before traveling for instant activation

setupInstructions.title: Install eSIM
setupInstructions.description: Scan QR code or use provider's app to install

setupInstructions.title: Activate Upon Arrival
setupInstructions.description: Enable your eSIM when you land in Albania
setupInstructions.details: Your eSIM will automatically connect to local networks

coverage.ruralCoverage: Good coverage in most areas, limited in remote mountainous regions

tips.title: Purchase Before Travel
tips.description: Buy your eSIM before departure to avoid connectivity issues upon arrival

tips.title: Check Data Needs
tips.description: Estimate your usage - browsing uses much less data than streaming

tips.title: Keep Physical SIM
tips.description: Maintain your home SIM for emergency calls and important communications

tips.title: Download Offline Maps
tips.description: Pre-download maps and translations to save data while exploring

troubleshooting.solution: Ensure code is clear and well-lit, try different angles
Restart your device and try again, or contact provider support
Check if eSIM is enabled in settings, verify network selection
Check if daily data limit reached, try different network if available

unescoSites.name: Historic Centres of Berat and Gjirokastër

funFacts.title: Affordable Travel
funFacts.description: Experience luxury at budget prices - Albania offers incredible value for money

funFacts.title: Warm Hospitality
funFacts.description: Albanian people are known for their incredible hospitality and welcoming nature

funFacts.title: Diverse Landscapes
funFacts.description: From beaches to mountains - experience incredible diversity in a compact country

funFacts.title: Year-Round Destination
funFacts.description: Perfect climate for visiting any time - beaches in summer, mountains year-round

extraFunFacts.title: Bunker Paradise
extraFunFacts.description: Albania has over 700,000 concrete bunkers built during communist era - that's 1 bunker for every 4 people!

extraFunFacts.title: Warm Hospitality
extraFunFacts.description: Albanian people are known for their incredible hospitality and welcoming nature

extraFunFacts.title: Land of Eagles
extraFunFacts.description: Albania means 'Land of Eagles' in Albanian. The double-headed eagle on their flag represents the north and south of the country.

extraFunFacts.title: Religious Harmony
extraFunFacts.description: Albania is the only European country with a Muslim majority, yet it's one of the most religiously tolerant nations in the world.

extraFunFacts.title: Global Albanian Diaspora
extraFunFacts.description: More Albanians live outside Albania than inside! With over 7 million Albanians worldwide and only 2.8 million in Albania itself, the diaspora spans across Italy, Greece, US, Germany, and beyond.

supermarkets.name: Conad Supermarkets
supermarkets.description: Italian supermarket chain with 22 locations in Tirana offering quality products
supermarkets.shortDescription: Premium Italian supermarket chain with extensive coverage
keyFeatures: Extensive network of 22 stores in Tirana

supermarkets.name: SPAR Supermarkets
supermarkets.description: International supermarket chain with around 90 locations across Albania
supermarkets.location: Multiple locations in Tirana and Albania
supermarkets.shortDescription: International supermarket chain with extensive Albanian network

supermarkets.name: Big Market
supermarkets.description: Large supermarket chain with 180 stores across Albania
supermarkets.shortDescription: Albania's largest supermarket chain with extensive coverage
keyFeatures: Both retail and cash & carry formats

localMarkets.name: New Bazaar (Pazari i Ri)
localMarkets.description: Historic renovated marketplace for fresh produce, meat, fish, and local products
localMarkets.location: Avni Rustemi Square, 8 minutes walk from city center
localMarkets.shortDescription: Historic market offering fresh local produce and traditional products

localMarkets.name: Tregu i Çamëve (Çam Market)
localMarkets.description: Main clothing and miscellaneous items market in central Tirana
localMarkets.address: Shyqyri Bërxolli and Reshit Çollaku streets
localMarkets.shortDescription: Central daily market for clothing and miscellaneous items

localMarkets.name: Medrese Market
localMarkets.description: Large indoor clothing market with materials and household linens
localMarkets.shortDescription: Large indoor market for new clothes, materials, and household items

departmentStores.name: Berlin Texx
departmentStores.description: Second-hand store chain offering clothing, shoes, bedding, and household items
departmentStores.shortDescription: Second-hand department store with branded items and fixed prices

practicalTips.title: Shopping Hours
practicalTips.tip: Most supermarkets open 7:00-22:00. Local markets busiest in mornings until 13:00-15:00.

practicalTips.title: Payment Methods
practicalTips.tip: Supermarkets accept cards, but bring cash for local markets and street vendors.

practicalTips.title: Bring Your Own Bags
practicalTips.tip: Plastic bags cost extra. Bring reusable bags or purchase at checkout.

practicalTips.title: Language Tip
practicalTips.tip: Learn basic Albanian: 'Sa kushton?' (How much?), 'Faleminderit' (Thank you).

practicalTips.title: Market Etiquette
practicalTips.tip: Haggling expected at flea markets, but not at supermarkets or formal stores.

practicalTips.title: Best Shopping Times
practicalTips.tip: Visit markets early (8:00-10:00) for best selection and freshest produce.

wasteDisposal.title: Waste & Recycling
wasteDisposal.description: Understanding waste disposal and recycling in Albania
generalRules: Household waste collected daily in most urban areas
Place bags outside between 6:00-8:00 AM for collection
No specific recycling bins in most residential areas
Bring your own bags for shopping to reduce waste

recyclingTips.title: Best sunset viewpoint
recyclingTips.tip: Dajti Express cable car - go 1 hour before sunset for stunning views with fewer crowds

recyclingTips.title: General Waste
recyclingTips.tip: Put household waste in provided bins or bags outside your accommodation, trash separation is recommended but not enforced.

recyclingTips.title: Water Safety
recyclingTips.tip: Bring your own water bottles - tap water is generally not safe to drink in most urban areas.

essentialServices.title: Pharmacies (Farmaci)
essentialServices.description: Open daily 8:00-20:00, some 24/7 in city center. No prescription needed for basic medicines.

essentialServices.title: Laundromats
essentialServices.description: Self-service laundries available in city center. Hotels often provide laundry service.

essentialServices.title: Post Office (Posta Shqiptare)
essentialServices.description: Open Mon-Fri 8:00-16:00, Sat 8:00-12:00. Main post office at Rruga Dëshmorët e 4 Shkurtit.

electricalInfo.title: Plug Types
electricalInfo.description: Albania uses Type C (Europlug) and Type F (Schuko) plugs. Standard European outlets throughout the country.

electricalInfo.title: Voltage & Frequency
electricalInfo.description: 230V, 50Hz electrical system. Compatible with most European devices. Check your device specifications before plugging in.

electricalInfo.title: Adapters Needed
electricalInfo.description: US/UK travelers need Type C/F adapters. Canadians, Australians need adapters. Most EU devices work directly.

electricalInfo.title: Where to Buy Adapters
electricalInfo.description: Available at electronics stores, supermarkets (Conad, SPAR), and mobile phone shops. Expect to pay 500-1500 ALL (€5-15).

electricalInfo.title: Safety Tips
electricalInfo.description: Use surge protectors for valuable electronics. Older buildings may have less reliable grounding. Hotels provide safe power.

seasonalWeather.conditions: Mild and pleasant with occasional rain
highlights: Perfect for hiking and outdoor activities
Moderate rainfall, bring light rain jacket

seasonalWeather.conditions: Hot and dry with intense sunshine
highlights: Beach season with crystal clear waters
Very hot inland, cooler by the coast
Little to no rainfall, perfect for beach activities
Harvest season with great local produce

seasonalWeather.conditions: Mild and wet with occasional snow
highlights: Mild coastal winters, snow in mountains
Great for cultural activities and museums

airConditioning.title: Hotel AC Availability
airConditioning.description: Most hotels have AC, but older accommodations might not. Always check before booking. Usually included in room rate

airConditioning.title: Apartment Rentals
airConditioning.description: Airbnb and private rentals often have split AC units. Confirm availability before booking. Electricity costs €0.08-0.12/kWh.

airConditioning.title: Public Spaces
airConditioning.description: Shopping malls, restaurants, and cafés are well air-conditioned during summer.

clothingGuide.title: Summer Clothing
clothingGuide.tip: Light, breathable fabrics. Bring sun hat and sunglasses. Pack modest clothes for religious sites.

clothingGuide.title: Spring/Autumn
clothingGuide.tip: Layered clothing recommended. Light rain jacket essential for spring and autumn visits.

clothingGuide.title: Winter Clothing
clothingGuide.tip: Warm layers for mountains, lighter clothes for coast. Waterproof jacket recommended.

weatherTips.title: Sun Protection
weatherTips.tip: Albanian sun is intense, especially in summer. SPF 30+ sunscreen essential, reapply frequently.

weatherTips.title: Summer Hydration
weatherTips.tip: Drink plenty of water during hot summer months. Carry water bottle, especially for hiking.

weatherTips.title: Best Times to Visit
weatherTips.tip: May-June and September-October offer perfect weather. July-August are hottest but best for beaches.

weatherTips.title: Weather Apps
weatherTips.tip: Use local weather apps or international ones like Weather.com for accurate forecasts.

weatherTips.title: Mountain Weather
weatherTips.tip: Mountain weather changes quickly. Bring extra layers even in summer for altitude changes.

history.title: Illyrian Kingdoms
history.description: The Illyrians, ancestors of modern Albanians, establish powerful kingdoms across the western Balkans. These ancient tribes are known for their warrior culture and strategic coastal settlements.

history.title: Roman Conquest
history.description: Romans conquer Illyrian territories after defeating Queen Teuta and King Gentius. The region becomes part of the Roman Empire, bringing Latin influence and infrastructure development.

history.title: Byzantine Period
history.description: Albania becomes part of the Byzantine Empire after the division of Rome. Orthodox Christianity spreads, and the region experiences significant cultural and architectural development.

history.title: Principality of Arbër
history.description: The first Albanian state is established by Progon in Krujë. This marks the beginning of Albanian medieval kingdoms and the development of distinct Albanian identity.

history.title: Skanderbeg's Resistance
history.description: Gjergj Kastrioti (Skanderbeg) leads a 25-year resistance against Ottoman expansion, becoming Albania's national hero. His victories at Krujë inspire European resistance against Ottoman rule.

history.title: Ottoman Rule
history.description: Albania becomes part of the Ottoman Empire for over 400 years. Many Albanians convert to Islam, and the period sees significant cultural and architectural influence from Ottoman civilization.

history.title: League of Prizren
history.description: Albanian leaders form the League of Prizren to defend Albanian territories and promote autonomy. This marks the beginning of the Albanian National Awakening movement.

history.title: Independence Declaration
history.description: Albania declares independence from the Ottoman Empire in Vlorë on November 28. Ismail Qemali raises the Albanian flag, establishing the first sovereign Albanian state in modern times.

history.title: World War II
history.description: Albania endures Italian and German occupations during WWII. Albanian partisans, led by communists, conduct fierce resistance operations throughout the mountainous country.

history.title: Communist Era
history.description: Enver Hoxha establishes a strict communist regime, isolating Albania from both East and West. The period features massive industrialization but severe political repression and economic isolation.

history.title: Democratic Transition
history.description: Communist rule ends with student protests and democratic reforms. Albania begins its transition to democracy and market economy, opening to the world after decades of isolation.

history.title: NATO Membership
history.description: Albania joins NATO, marking its full integration into Western security structures. This represents a major milestone in Albania's Euro-Atlantic integration process.

eventWebsites.name: RA.CO Events Albania
eventWebsites.description: Electronic music events, club nights, and music festivals happening in Albania

eventWebsites.name: Events Albania
eventWebsites.description: Comprehensive event listings for concerts, festivals, cultural events, and entertainment across Albania

eventWebsites.name: GetYourGuide Albania
eventWebsites.description: Tours, activities, and unique experiences you can book in advance

eventWebsites.name: Airbnb Experiences
eventWebsites.description: Local experiences and activities hosted by Albanians

eventWebsites.name: Eventbrite Albania
eventWebsites.description: Local events, workshops, seminars, and community gatherings

eventTips.title: Check Multiple Sources
eventTips.tip: Events can be listed on different platforms - check multiple sites for complete listings

eventTips.title: Language Note
eventTips.tip: Some local events may be listed only in Albanian - use translation tools if needed

eventTips.title: Booking Tips
eventTips.tip: Popular events sell out quickly in summer - book tours and experiences in advance

eventTips.title: Seasonal Events
eventTips.tip: Summer has the most events and festivals, but cultural events happen year-round
